body.body: Internal investigations have identified that a possible cause for the Triumph semi active suspension, ABS and traction control to be disabled is a loose battery cable at the alternator.
If any of the above mentioned systems become disabled, before connecting the Triumph diagnostic tool, check the lock nut securing the battery cable to the alternator as described below:
Check and, if necessary, tighten the lock nut securing the battery cable to the alternator to
Check to ensure that there is sufficient thread of the terminal stud protruding above the lock nut, as shown in the illustration below.
An alternative lock nut (part number T3350305) for retaining the battery lead to the alternator is available if required.
If there is insufficient thread protruding above the lock nut, remove and discard the lock nut.
Fit the alternative lock nut (part number T3350305) and tighten to
The crankcase ground fixing can be found below the seat bridge, on top of the crankcase mounting (left hand side near the upper mounting lock nut).
Check and, if necessary, tighten the crankcase ground fixing to
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool, carry out a diagnostics check and clear any DTCs that may be stored.
Please mark your copy of the Service Manual with this information.

Please mark your copy of the Service Manual with this information. For electronic service manuals, store this information in a readily accessible place and refer to it often. This information will be included in the next service manual update.
